titleStmt.title: Thomas Smith Gent: In Praise of the Worke.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Thomas Smith Gent: In Praise of the Worke.

monogr.title: Varietie of lute-lessons : viz. fantasies, pauins, galliards, almaines, corantoes, and volts: selected out of the best approued authors, as well beyond the seas as of our owne country. By Robert Douland. VVhereunto is annexed certaine obseruations belonging to lute-playing: by Iohn Baptisto Besardo of Visonti. Also a short treatise thereunto appertayning: by Iohn Douland Batcheler of Musicke

div.head: Thomas Smith Gent: In Praise of the Worke.
div.l: WHere Merit far surmounts the pitch of Praise,
The Good-worke there, transcends the reach of Words;
This Worke is such: then good-words cannot raise
Their waight so high as these Heau'n-scaling Cordes:
Then let their vertue their owne glory raise,
Least it be said a Smith hath forg'd their praise.
